title: Improve Process::Status#to_json
body:
Because Process::Status has no instance_variables, the
ActiveSupport version of #to_json produces {}, which isn't good.

Therefore, we implement our own #as_json, which makes it useful
again.

Fixes #4857

title: Few more warnings removed.
body:
I found them when I was running
warning mode on with railties

See https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/3782

title: Fix find_in_batches with customized primary_key
body: Although we set primary_key other than id, we should compute offsets by  any primary_key.

body:
This reverts commit 533a9f84b035756eedf9fdccf0c494dc9701ba72.

This fixes #3956.

body: This is a rebased version of #2520.

title: Query for loading index info should be marked as SCHEMA.
body:
related to #7544.

cc/ @fxn

title: Set up config_accessor with a default value by block
body:
* ActiveSupport::Configurable should allow config_accessor to take
  default value by block, just like `cattr_accessor`.

    ```
    class User
      include ActiveSupport::Configurable
      config_accessor :hair_colors do
        [:brown, :black, :blonde, :red]
      end
    end

    User.hair_colors # => [:brown, :black, :blonde, :red]
    ```

* remove trailing whitespaces in configurable.rb and its test file.

It's an old pull request #5730, but no one implement it . I just implement it like someone suggested, change the interface to just like `cattr_accessor`.

title: Allowing pass couple extension to one register_template_handler call
body:
To make possible add synonyms extension by one function call

```ruby
ActionView::Template.register_template_handler :md, :markdown, markdown_handler
```

title: Deprecate ActiveSupport::Benchmarkable#silence.
body:
It's not thread safe at all.

I also removed two tests that were testing its behavior so that the suite doesn't throw deprecation warnings. I'm not 100% sure this is the right thing to do.

I'm also not sure if this is a 'deprecate in 3-2-stable, remove in master' situation or a 'deprecate in master, remove in 4.1' situation.

This fixes #4060.

/cc @tenderlove

title: update CHANGELOG
body:
Add entry about 245941101b1ea00a9b1af613c20b0ee994a43946 and
95be790ece75710f2588558a6d5f40fd09543b97.

title: use presence method instead of checking for blank
Fixes issue #5660: Failsafe exception returns text/html and text/plain.
body:
If the request format is text/html then return the existing failsafe
response. For all other formats return text/plain.

The original issue points out to return JSON at the appropriate time,
however as @wycats pointed out, it's often better to return text/plain.

title: warning removed: shadowing outer local variable - message
Build fix for ActionMailer
body:
See

http://travis-ci.org/#!/rails/rails/jobs/2444632

title: 3 2 stable
body: Back-port test coverage to preserve the health of the PostgreSQL auto-reconnection functionality.

title: Freeze columns before using them as hash keys
body: This reduces the number of allocated strings from columns * (rows + 1) to just columns.  This should fix #7629.

title: Allow passing block to deep_merge and deep_merge!
body:
Hash#merge accepts block that you can use to customize how hash values are merged. This change makes merge and deep_merge compatible.

http://www.ruby-doc.org/core-1.9.3/Hash.html#method-i-merge

title: Migration revert
body:
Same as https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/7280 with doc updated and rebased.

Had to create a new pull request as previous one did not update (presumably because I had to recreate my fork in the meantime...)

title: update ConnectionAdapter::Column#type_cast_code to be compatible with rails 3.2 branch
body:
Hi Folks,

This commits makes the legacy method ConnectionAdapter::Column#type_cast_code compatible with the fix applied to the 3.2 branch in the pull request #7509.

cc @rafaelfranca @carlosantoniodasilva

title: Update documentation for CollectionProxy
body: CollectionProxy doesn't undefine `class` and other basic methods (halleluia) since c86a32d7451 and this commit changes the doc to reflect this.

title: Implement :null_session CSRF protection method
body:
It's further work on CSRF after 245941101b1ea00a9b1af613c20b0ee994a43946.

The :null_session CSRF protection method provide an empty session during
request processing but doesn't reset it completely (as :reset_session
does).

title: add --skip-ignore and --skip-keeps options to generators.
body:
This is an updated version of #2808.

It closes #2800. Users of other SCM's can now generate rails
apps that will add the "empty" directories to source control,
but will not have a useless .gitignore or mis-named .gitkeep
files.

title: Nice and easy delegation to the class
body:
Simple patch to allow delegation to class. With it, one can:

    class FooFeatureController < ActionController::Base
      def self.feature_name
        controller_name.sub /_feature$/, ''
      end
      # In the same way that controller_name is available from the instances too:
      delegate :feature_name, :to => :class
    end


Without it, one gets a relatively obscure syntax error message.

    rails/activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/module/delegation.rb:142:in `module_eval': test/core_ext/module_test.rb:37: syntax error, unexpected '.' (SyntaxError)
                class.table_name(*args, &block)    ...
                      ^
    test/core_ext/module_test.rb:39: syntax error, unexpected '.'
                if class.nil?                         ...
                         ^
    test/core_ext/module_test.rb:44: syntax error, unexpected keyword_end, expecting $end
              end                                                 # end
                 ^

It's already possible to use `delegate :foo, :to => 'self.class'` but that is less obvious (and also won't give the expected result with `:prefix => true`)


This PR fixes above failures.

title: Always encode double quotes in HTML attributes values.
body:
HTML tags generated by `TagHelper#tag` always enclose their attribute values in double quotes ("). Therefore, it never makes sense to allow an unescaped double quote within an attribute value. It shouldn't matter if the attribute value is a `SafeBuffer` (html_safe). It shouldn't matter if the `escape` parameter is `false`. No matter what the caller provides as an attribute value, `#tag` should ensure the HTML it generates properly encloses that value in double quotes.

This is an example failing test:

    def test_not_really_safe
      assert_equal %(<input value="supposedly "safe"" />), tag('input', :value => 'supposedly "safe"'.html_safe)
      # generates: <input value="supposedly "safe"" />, and the browser will see the value as "supposedly "
    end


Closes issue #7609 (previous pull request sent for 3.2 stable branch)

title: Warn when generator cannot load
body:
[close #6217]  If a generator has an error we should display that error rather than swallowing it while allowing other generator sot be listed. This is useful while developing a generator.

ATP Railties
